question: A 25-year-old woman is diagnosed with subserosal fibroids. She is married and wishes to soon start a family. What is the best treatment plan for her?
What is the definition of small for gestational age fetuses?

answers.option: Weight more than 90th centile for the appropriate gestational age
Weight less than 10th centile for the appropriate gestational age
Abdominal circumference less than the 10th centile

question: A 29-year-old married lady presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of left breast swelling for the past 4 months. Family history is positive for breast and ovarian malignancy. On local examination, a large ulcerated swelling measuring 15x12x10 cm is detected in the left breast. The mass was firm to soft in consistency, emitting putrid-smelling discharge, non-tender to touch, and bosselated leaf-like appearance with erythema of surrounding skin. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The World Health Organization classifies endometrial hyperplasia into how many categories?
A woman who had previously undergone a hysterectomy presents with prolapse from the vagina. What is this type of prolapse called?

An 80-year-old woman presents with third-degree vaginal prolapse. She is also positive for hepatitis C and her coagulation profile is deranged. Which of the following is the most suitable treatment for her?
Primordial germ cells arise in which of the following?

A 50-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with heavy menstrual bleeding and weight loss. On examination, pallor is present but jaundice is not. Per abdominal: Uterus is enlarged with irregular margins and restricted mobility, no palpable lymph nodes. Vaginal examination: the uterus is of 18 weeks in size, irregular margins, fornices clear. Her endometrial biopsy confirms endometrial carcinoma. Her MRI done shows a 6 cm by 7 cm irregular mass in the uterine cavity invading the myometrium and cervix. There is no breach of serosa or involvement of adnexa or enlarged lymph nodes. What is the appropriate surgical approach considering her MRI?

answers.option: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

question: A 40-year-old lady, P3+0, with no previous normal deliveries, a known diabetic, presented to you in the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy and painful periods for two years. Abdominal examination is unremarkable. On pelvic examination, the uterus is soft, 10 weeks in size, and tender, both fornices were clear. Pelvic ultrasound shows an endometrial thickness of 12 mm with a bulky uterus, diffusely thickened endometrium, and normal ovaries. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 33-year-old woman presents to the clinic with pain in her pelvic region. The doctor advises an ultrasound to investigate the cause and it shows a 10 cm, fluid-filled, ovarian cyst. Histopathology shows cyst lined by stratified squamous epithelium with hair, sebaceous glands, and neural tissue. Which of the following neoplasms is most likely?

A young lady presents with irregular vaginal bleeding. She is concerned for her health because her mother had cervical carcinoma. The gynecologist advises a pap smear testing which reveals cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia is strongly associated with which of these?
Adding a progestin to the estrogenic component of hormone replacement therapy for postmenopausal women provides which of the following effects?

answers.option: Reduces the risk for endometrial cancer
Provides better control of problematic hot flushes

question: A 35-year-old woman, para 4+0, presents with second-degree uterovaginal prolapse two months after the delivery of her last baby. What will be the appropriate treatment option for her?

A 22-year-old woman passes grape-like masses in the 16th week of pregnancy. She had left fetal movement. On examination, she measured 18 weeks uterus. Dilatation and curettage (D&C) is performed. Histopathology exam shows large avascular villi along with trophoblast proliferation. Which of the following is the best method to employ her follow-up care?

A 24-year-old primigravida came in the outpatient department at 30 weeks of gestation with a complaint of headache. On examination, her blood pressure is 140/190 mmHg and urine D/R shows no proteinuria. What would be the most likely diagnosis?

The doctor has just delivered a child of an 18-year-old woman (G1 para 0), who is pre-eclamptic. Her uterus is soft with moderate to heavy bleeding. Examination reveals no laceration. What is the most common cause of postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)?

A 46-year-old male patient presents with urinary obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination shows that the patient has prostatic enlargement and is diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia. The physician decides to start finasteride. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of finasteride?

answers.option: Lowering circulating as well as prostatic dihydrotestosterone concentration
Blocking testosterone receptors in the prostate gland
Having dual inhibitory effects on LH secretion from pituitary and testosterone synthesis from testes
Reducing LH secretion from pituitary hence reducing the testosterone synthesis

question: About 10-month-old Farah is brought to the pediatric clinic with a complaint of cough for 3 days. The child is febrile but taking feed well. Her respiratory rate is 72 breaths per minute but no chest in-drawing. According to integrated management of childhood and neonatal illnesses guidelines (IMNCI), she will be classified as which of the following?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?
What is the Tanner stage associated with the breast having a secondary mound?
A pregnant woman is diagnosed with gestational diabetes and has an HbA1C level of >85 mmol/mol. What is the risk of fetal mortality?

A 28-year-old female, G3 P1+1 is brought to the emergency department with severe lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding for the past 3 hours. She is currently at the 10+3rd week of gestation. Ultrasound abdomen reveals an adnexal mass with serum beta-hcG levels of 5178 mIU/ml. She previously had an ectopic pregnancy and underwent a salpingectomy for it. What is the treatment of choice in this case?

A 40-year-old, para 5+0, known case of diabetes, presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of vaginal discharge and itching. Per vaginal examination reveals a thick white curdy discharge. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the confirmatory procedure to ascertain breech presentation in a pregnancy?
Which of the following conditions is the most closely associated with endometrial hyperplasia?
Which of the following conditions associated with oligohydramnios has the worst fetal outcomes?
Where does spermatogenesis take place?
Where is the mediastinum of the testis located?
Which of the following is a remnant of peritoneum that descends along the path of the descent of testis?

A middle-aged woman presents to the clinic with irregular menstrual bleeding. Endometrial biopsy shows increases endometrial glandular proliferation that results has resulted in an increased gland to stroma ratio, as compared to the normal proliferative epithelium. The ultrasound is normal. According to the patient, her maternal aunt had the same condition for which she underwent a hysterectomy. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A middle-aged woman presents to the clinic with complaints of irregular menstrual bleeding. Endometrial biopsy shows increased endometrial proliferation that resulted in an increased gland to stroma ratio as compared to normal proliferative endometrium, with the presence of desmoplastic stroma and complex epithelial growth patterns. There is a loss of function mutation of the PTEN tumor suppressor gene. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A middle-aged woman presented to the clinic with irregular menstrual bleeding. Her endometrial biopsy shows an increased endometrial glandular proliferation that results in an increased gland to stroma ratio, as compared to normal proliferative endometrium. She is subsequently diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia but wants to preserve fertility. Which of the following drug therapies will be most likely prescribed for treatment with close monitoring?
Which of the following vaccines of the expanded program on immunization (EPI) schedule is administered intradermally?
In the expanded program of immunization (EPI), which vaccine is ideally administered at 6 weeks of age in a newborn?

answers.option: Rotavirus, pneumococcal, pentavaccine, oral polio vaccine

question: Which of the following is formed as distention of an unruptured Graafian follicle or by the rupture followed by immediate resealing of the follicle?
Which of the following endometrial pathologies is termed as 'chocolate cyst'?
Use of oral contraceptive pills (OCP) is associated with a decreased risk of which of the following cancers?

A 22-year-old woman presents to the gynecologist with complaints of infrequent menstrual bleeding, excessively hairy body, acne, some dark skin patches, and weight gain of ten kilograms in the last five months. The doctor ordered some investigations and subsequently diagnosed her as a case of a polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS). This condition is characterized by which of the following?
Which of the following non-steroidal agents acts by competitively inhibiting androgenic receptors?
A baby is considered stillborn when it is born after how many weeks?

A 3-year-old child presents with dehydration following diarrhea for three days. The child is irritable, has sunken eyes, skin pinch goes back very slowly. What will be the appropriate management of this child according to IMNCI?
Where is the opening of Gartner duct cysts usually found?
Which of the following is the most common maternal cause of polyhydramnios?

A 29-year-old woman, G2P1, comes into the clinic for her routine antenatal checkup at 32 weeks of gestation with ultrasound reports showing mild polyhydramnios. She also has a history of gestational diabetes. Which of the following investigations would be advised by the doctor?
According to the integrated management for neonatal and childhood illness (IMNCI) guidelines, what is the lower cut-off for breathing rate for a child between 2 months up to 12 months of age?
A father brings in his 6-year-old son to the clinic with complaints of a heavy voice. The doctor determines that he is at Tanner stage 4. Which age corresponds to this Tanner stage?
What is the proper positioning for breastfeeding a baby?

answers.option: The gum line should not overlap with the areola
The breast should only be partially exposed
The nose of the infant should be away from the breast
The tongue moves backward, behind the lower gum
The areola should be completely in the mouth of infant

question: Which of the following is the most basic pillar of safe motherhood?
Which of the following is the most important advantage of breast milk as compared to formula milk?
How many pillars of safe motherhood have been devised by the World Health Organization (WHO)?
Which of the following is true regarding cryptorchidism?

answers.option: Orchiopexy completely eliminates the risk of sterility
Orchiopexy completely eliminates the risk of cancer
Cryptorchid testis carries a three to fivefold higher risk for testicular cancer
Present in 10-20% of one-year-old male infants
12% cases are associated with inguinal hernias

question: A 36-year-old nulliparous woman presents with a twin pregnancy. She is taking her multivitamins regularly. She is concerned about premature delivery. Which of the following is the most important risk factor for premature labor in her case?
How many years does it take for a high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL) of cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) to progress into cervical carcinoma?
What is the histological appearance of the epithelium in vaginal adenosis?
Which of the following vaccines is administered at 14 weeks of age in a newborn?
What is the appropriate age for the administration of the human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines in a female child?

A 28-year-old pregnant woman, G2P1, comes to the clinic in the 21st week of her pregnancy with complaints of a tense, tender abdomen, and a feeling of pressure. She also complains of severe pain and urinary frequency. She has a history of asymptomatic fibroids. What is her diagnosis?
Which of the following is not included in gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD)?
A 36-year-old lady presents with vaginal bleeding after 2 months of amenorrhea. The gynecologist suspects gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD). Which of the following is not a GTD?
Which of the following is the early clinical sign of respiratory distress syndrome?

A mother comes to the outpatient department with her 1-week-old baby. She thinks she is not producing enough milk and that the baby should be started on formula feed. Which of the following is a sign of good positioning during breastfeeding?

answers.option: Mouth wide open with lips inverted

question: A couple comes to the clinic with a newborn baby for advice regarding breastfeeding. The pediatrician counsels them regarding the benefits of breastfeeding. Which of the following is one of those benefits?

answers.option: Contains 80% water; no need to give water to the baby
Contains high proteins; good for baby's growth
Higher ratio of casein: whey so better absorption
Fore milk has more fat and hind milk has more lactose
More weight gain than formula milk

question: A full-term neonate is brought to the clinic for examination. The weight of the baby is 2.2 kg. The baby appears to have low-set ears and upward slanting eyes. Which of the following is the most likely cause of his growth retardation?

A middle-aged female presents with complaints of irregular menstrual cycle and excessive body hair. She is unmarried and has had hypertension for the last three years. Ultrasonography reveals the presence of multiple ovarian cysts. Polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS) is also associated with which of the following conditions?

A 28-year-old female presents to the gynecology outpatient department for her routine 5th-week postnatal checkup. She wants to take contraceptives so her gynecologist decides to start combined oral contraceptives. Which of the following is the primary mechanism of action of the combined estrogen-progestin oral contraceptive pill?

answers.option: Enhancing uterine contractions to dislodge the fertilized ovum
Suppression of FSH and LH release
Production of cervical mucus hostile to sperm penetration

question: Which of the following is the cut-off for fast breathing in a child who is 2 to 12 months old, according to IMNCI?

A pre-term baby is brought to the clinic on the third day of life with the complaint of abdominal distension and not passing stool for 2 days. On examination, gut sounds are absent. The mother says the child cried very late after birth. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the baby's symptoms?

A 20-day-old neonate, weighing 4.5 kg, is brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of abnormal position of the right upper limb. The mother has a history of diabetes during pregnancy. On examination, the arm is abducted and internally rotated with the pronated forearm. Biceps reflex and Moro reflex are absent on the right side. What is the most likely cause of his symptoms?

answers.option: Injury of the 5th and 6th cervical roots
Injury of the 7th and 8th cervical roots

question: A 40-year-old female para 5+0 comes to the outpatient department with complaints of heavy per vaginal bleeding and dysmenorrhea for 6 months. Upon examination, the uterus is 9-10 weeks in size. What is the diagnosis?

A 25-year-old nulliparous female married for the last 2 years comes to the outpatient department with complaints of inability to conceive. On examination, the uterus is 18 weeks in size. Ultrasound shows a 12 cm submucosal fibroid. What is the best treatment for this patient?

A 40-year-old female, para 4+0, comes to the outpatient department with a history of irregular per vaginal bleeding for 1 year. On examination, a fleshy growth is seen protruding from the cervix. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old unbooked patient comes to the outpatient department at 26 weeks gestation for antenatal booking. On examination height of the fundus is 32 weeks, lie is longitudinal, breech presentation, fetal heart sounds are present and liquor is excessive. What investigation is advised?

A 75-year-old woman presents with abdominal distention and a history of weight loss in the last three months. Her pelvic ultrasound shows a solid ovarian mass. Which of the following is the commonest ovarian tumor at this age?

A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with lower abdominal pain for three weeks. Ultrasound of her pelvis shows a left ovarian cyst containing hair and teeth. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 30-year-old pregnant female, G4, P3+0, comes to the emergency with complaints of 34 weeks of pregnancy with per vaginal bleeding and abdominal pain for one hour. On examination, blood pressure is 140/90 mm of Hg, the abdomen is tense and tender, heart rate is 140/min. On per vaginal examination, the cervical os is closed, and profuse per vaginal bleeding is observed. What is the most appropriate first step of management for her?

answers.option: Induction of labor with prostaglandin E2
Artificial rupture of membrane and augmentation with oxytocin

question: 26-year-old primigravida comes to the outpatient department at 25 weeks gestation with absent liquor. What investigation is advised?
A 28-year-old female para 2+0 comes to the outpatient department at 28 weeks gestation with increased liquor. What is the most important cause of polyhydramnios?

30-year-old primigravida presents to the clinic for antenatal care at 32 weeks gestation. Her symphysiofundal height (SFH) is 28 cm and her ultrasound shows a baby that is small for gestational age (SGA). What is the definition of such a baby?

answers.option: Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 50th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 90th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 70th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 5th centile for gestational age
Fetus with abdominal circumference or estimated fetal weight (EFW) less than 10th centile for gestational age

question: A 30-year-old primigravida presents to the antenatal clinic at 32 weeks gestation for a routine checkup. Her symphysiofundal height (SFH) is 28 cm. Her ultrasound findings show reduced liquor and small abdominal circumference for gestational age. Which of the following investigations will confirm small for gestational age?

An obese multigravida is admitted to the labor room for advanced labor. After the delivery of her baby, the shoulder of the baby fails to deliver. Which of the following maneuvers will help to deliver the shoulder?

A 25-year-old patient presents to the emergency on the 30th week of gestation with complaints of tonic-clonic fits at home. Which of the following drugs can be injected as the drug of choice to control her fits?
What drug is used to induce ovulation?
A couple comes to the clinic after 4 days of having unprotected sex. They do not plan to conceive. What is the best emergency contraceptive measure?
A study involving a group of people having a smoking history with lung cancer is compared with those who do not smoke that do not have lung cancer. What type of study is this?
A combined oral contraceptive pill is given best described for which of the following?

answers.option: Act by thickening of the mucus
Progesterone decreases the side effects of estrogen

question: PTEN mutation is associated with which of the following?
An increase in which of the following hormones can cause endometrial carcinoma?
After giving birth 4 weeks ago a woman presents to the clinic with complaints of excessive crying. Which of the following is she experiencing?
Which of the following is the correct sequence of events for growth?

answers.option: Menarche, adrenarche, thelarche, and growth spurt
Thelarche, adrenarche, growth spurt, and menarche
Growth spurt, thelarche, adrenarche, and menarche
Thelarche, adrenarche, menarche, and growth spurt
Adrenarche, menarche, thelarche, and growth spurt

question: Spiral arteries become more convoluted, endometrium growth occurs, and fluid secretion begins. What phase of the menstrual cycle is this?
A patient has amenorrhea, hirsutism, and multiple cysts. What is the first-line treatment?

A 55-year-old woman presents to the clinic with complaints of something protruding out of her vagina for the past 5 years. She is parity 4+0 and her last child was born 18 years ago. She is a cattle farmer. Which of the following is the most significant factor in developing this condition?
What is the most important side effect of medroxyprogesterone?
A newborn presents to the clinic with jitteriness. The mother has a history of diabetes. Calcium is 7.5 mg/dl, magnesium 2.5 mg/dl, glucose 55 mg/dl. What is likely happening in this baby?

A 25-year-old female, 10 days postpartum, presents with mild fever, abdominal pain, and vaginal bleeding. She had a simple vaginal delivery at home 10 days ago. The cervical os is closed. What is the diagnosis?
An endometrial biopsy shows an increased gland to stroma ratio and the glands are cystically dilated. No nuclear atypia is seen. What is this condition associated with?
A woman comes to the clinic 2 weeks postpartum. She complains of itching and on examination, there are cracks on her breast as well as erythema. Which organism is most likely to cause this?
Which of the following is endometrial hyperplasia associated with?
According to Integrated Management of Childhood Illness (IMNCI), what is a danger sign?
A mother comes to the clinic for a pregnancy routine visit. She is advised to get a tetanus toxoid vaccine. What pillar of safe motherhood is this?
What is the most common cause of death for children in developing countries?
A 10-year-old child has been wetting the bed for years and has been wearing diapers since birth. What is the likely cause?
What is the best test to screen for diabetes mellitus after pregnancy?
A woman is fully dilated and has been pushing but is now too exhausted to push further. The station is +1. What is the best management?
An APGAR score between 7-10 is best described by which of the following?
A yolk sac tumor has which histopathological finding?
What is the best way to detect ovulation?
A baby is blue, grimacing, a heart rate of 120 beats/minute, respiration is with effort, and some flexion. What is the APGAR score?
Gonads forming testis are derived from which of the following?
Mifepristone is indicated in which of the following?

A woman breastfeeding her 1-year-old baby with a blood pressure of 140/90 mmHg and an HbA1c of 6.1% has a history of swollen leg and pain in her previous pregnancy. What is MEC category 4 in this case?
What maneuver is done to deliver a baby's head in a breech presentation?
Which of the following conditions is heavily associated with a smoking history?
A woman is currently in labor and has progressed from 4 cm dilatation to 7 cm in the past 5 hours. At this point, labor has stopped progressing. What is this called?
A newborn has a pulse of 65 beats and respirations of 6 breaths/minute, what is the next step?
What makes estrogen and progesterone contraceptives?

answers.option: Estrogen antagonizes the effect of progestin

question: A woman had normally progressing labor but then could not sustain normal contractions. What is given?
In polycystic ovarian syndrome, virilization is due to which of the following?
Yolk sac tumor has which of the following histopathological features?
A couple is trying to conceive. The semen sample shows 3% sperm motility. What is the best management?

answers.option: Intracytoplasmic sperm injection with in vitro fertilization

question: A woman has a tubal pregnancy. She has a blood pressure of 125/80 mm Hg, a pulse of 81 beats/minute, and respirations are 16 breaths/minute. What is management?
Preterm birth is what age?
What is the worst prognosis of oligohydramnios?
